Current Role: 	Master Consultant – Sustainability, Safety & OpEx at JMJ
Location: 		London, UK
Summary:
Gill is not your classic out and out sales / BD professional. I would describe her as a “rainmaker” who by nature has seller-doer mentality but truly consultative in her approach. She is passionate about creating bespoke solutions for each customer that will offer long-term value for that organisation and enjoys working in a creative and innovative environment. She collaborates closely with other consulting teams in the business to ensure that she can offer the best possible solution for the customer.
Her current role is Master Consultant for JMJ in London. This was a newly created role for her which she started in 2020 and it has responsibility for designing and delivery bespoke solutions to key clients’ needs. Prior to this she was a Senior Consultant with a ‘cradle to grave’ approach – she works with key customers up to C-suite level and promoting best practice and continuous improvement across JMJ, especially with mentoring and coaching of more junior staff.
She has strong relationships with multinational corporate customers in various sectors, some of which include BHP Billiton, Shell, BP, Maersk Oil, Qatar Petroleum, Centrica, Novo Nordisk etc. and proven experience in the international environment – Europe, Asia Pacific, Africa, North America.
As discussed recently, Gill is not actively looking but she is intrigued by what DEKRA are trying to achieve. She has heard mixed messages about the company’s past reputation but change management is something she loves and she likes the idea of playing an influential role in instigating a step change in an organisation and helping to develop the long-term roadmap for DEKRA Organisational & Process Safety.
If she were to make a move, she would need to be convinced that the company has the right strategic vision when it comes to sustainability, transformation initiatives (such as digital innovations), agile working etc. and would need to feel comfortable that Senior Management would support change management practices.
With this in mind, she is open to having an introductory call with you to discuss DEKRA and the O&PS business in more depth, after which she should hopefully have more assurance on whether it’s the right company for her or not.
Current Package:
Do not have exact breakdown but base salary in the £110/115k mark plus bonus and benefits.
Candidate Name:	Gill Kernick
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		London, UK
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Business Administration (Honours) Cum Laude – University of Natal, Durban (1993)
Subjects included Training and Development, Corporate Strategy & Human Resource Management.
Bachelor of Commerce, Upper Second equivalent – University of Witwatersrand, Johannesburg (1992)
Professional:
Academy of Executive Coaching, Systemic Team Coaching (2017)
Certified practitioner in Operating States (methodology to bring projects sustainably into existence) (2015)
School of Coaching, Public Coaching Programme, Senior Practitioner (2013)
Member of EMCC (2013)
CAREER SUMMARY
2011 to date JMJ Associates, London
2020 to date
Position: Master Consultant – Sustainability, Safety & Operational Excellence
Bringing innovative approaches to designing and delivering bespoke solutions to client’s needs. This has included experimenting with innovative measurement techniques e.g., big data and narrative analysis.
Leading a working group to design JMJ’s sustainability practice.
Upgrading our IIF suite with the latest thinking in HOP, Safety II, and complexity.
Working across regions to advise other consulting teams on innovative solutions and the latest thinking in safety.
Clients include: Spirit Energy, PM Group, Metro (Denmark), A Big Data Company
2011 – 2019
Position: Senior Consultant – Safety, Culture, Leadership
Designing and delivering client engagements (from cradle to grave).
Internal roles have included coaching leadership teams and developing consultants.
External Key Projects included:
Centrica - Organisational Change through Safety – Complex, emergent engagement beginning with top 50 Senior Executives. Currently working with largest part of the business on an innovative approach driven by the front line and using technology to connect and learn across a 14,000 workforce. (2016 – present)
Qatar Petroleum - Strategy and Values Roll Out – Designed and delivered innovative approach to strategy and values using a blended combination of workshops and technology to engage 10,000 + employees in the new direction of the company. Work extended to include Code of Conduct and Ethics and engaging external stakeholder. (2017-2018)
Internal Responsibilities and Achievements:
Awarded Consultant of the Year 2018 by the Board of Directors. And Team of the Year 2016.
Founder member of JMJ Academy accountable for developing internal consultant capability, global and regional roles in Africa and Europe.
JMJ Coaching Faculty: Delivering the School of Coaching Leadership Coaching and Executive Coaching Programmes globally. Global SME.
1999 – 2010 Landmark Education – London & Germany
Position: Country Manager & Financial Controller
Accountable to EMEA Director for operations, revenue generation and programme quality and delivery. Managing 10 staff/leaders and 100+ volunteers. Grew regional participation by 60%.
Implementing standardisation of financial controls and management across EMEA.
Leading transformational programmes to groups of 50 to 150. Leading turnaround projects globally for centres that were underperforming.
1996 – 1998 European Business School – London
Position: Lecturer – Skills Development
Accountable for developing skills with Staff and Student’s at the European Business School.
Designed, developed, and delivered a skills development course to first year students enabling them to identify the skills needed to succeed in the world today such as innovation, ability to manage change, complexity and interacting with the digital world.
Worked with academic staff on developing and identifying the skills needed for the students to succeed.
1995 – 1996 Kingston University – London
Position: Co-ordinator – Academic Development
Responsible for the overall operation of the Peer Assisted Learning scheme including training and supervising the students and staff adjusting the programme to meet individual needs.
1993 – 1995 University of Natal – Durban, S. Africa
Position: Lecturer / Researcher EMEC
The Economics and Management Extended Curriculum Programme (EMEC) was established to increase the number of Black Commerce graduates in a post-apartheid South Africa.
Overall co-ordination of all aspects of the EMEC Programme including selection and training of tutors, counselling students, and gathering feedback and results.
Developed, designed, and delivered the Core Skills Development Programme.
Consultant to other universities in the region.
COMMENT
An internationally experienced Strategic Consultant specialising in Safety, Culture and Leadership, with a track record of producing results through Intellectual Property Design, C-Suite Culture Change Strategy Delivery, Public Speaking and Coaching and Leadership Development.
An agile, strategic thinker with the ability to operate at all levels of an organisation and across diverse cultures, bringing thought partnership to bespoke change interventions. She partners with Multi-National Corporations to create sustainable change, focusing on building leadership and management capabilities in complex, high risk environments. Her core belief is that developing and unlocking principle and values-based leadership capability is the key to sustainable culture change.
A passion is the prevention of major accidents. The key to understanding and mitigating against catastrophic risk demands the ability to lead and navigate systemic complexity. Core to this is valuing equality of life and equality of voice. All lives matter and matter equally and all voices count. Those with power must ensure all voices are heard.
She lived on the 21st Floor of Grenfell Tower from 2011 to 2014 and watched it burn. Seven of her former neighbours died, including Logan-Isaac, the youngest victim who was still-born. She vowed to do what it takes to ensure society learns and to bring the thinking and learning from major accidents and speak and write to enable this.
In 2020 she was publicly voted one of SHP’s top 25 most influential people in Health and Safety in the UK for this work and she will be publishing a book Catastrophe & Systemic change in Q2 2021.
Authenticity, compassion, and courage are cornerstone values. She is passionate about creating trusting relationships between Executives and the Front Line, thereby unleashing discretionary effort and sustained impact on performance.
Clients include Centrica, Metro (Denmark), Shell, BP, Maersk Oil, Novo Nordisk, BHP Billiton, and Biogen. Her work has taken her all over the UK and Europe, and to Siberia, Mozambique, Algeria, Singapore, Malaysia, Australia and across North America.
She lives in London and adores travelling, working in and learning about new cultures.
